Sounds like it's worth a try because Xanax doesn't work. Xanax just makes me sleepy. I was taking a very low dose (1mg) prescription from my doctor for close to 7 years. Once I was properly weaned off of it, with doctors approval and instructions I felt so much better. I didn't realize that I had just been living in a fog the whole time I was taking Xanax. I didn't notice my anxiety being any better while on medication. So it wasn't any different once I stopped the medication. My anxiety is still awful. It absolutely sucks. I'm looking into getting my Medical Marijuana Card. My doctor says it will help my anxiety, my arthritis, back problems, sleep issues and it will also help my super severe crohns disease. The goal will be to get off a couple more medications. It sounds like a miracle that's too good to be true!

Im no expert but when i see people talk about how lonely the world has become and how times have changed, i think its important to remember the world for a long time ignored or didnt acknowledge mental illnesses like anxiety and depression. Humans have been dealing with these complex psychological journeys throughout time, and we're finally getting to a point where its not stigmatized anymore, its got people with representation and voices, and people get help. I know it seems really sad, and im sure society has evolved in a way that houses some lonely affection deprived people, but i think of this also as a way to help people who wonder and ask questions about how they feel and explore ways to relax and be comforted in a healthy way.
